article.headline: Baylor 95, Grambling State 69
article.story: WACO, Texas (AP) -- Tweety Carter scored 19 points, while Aaron Bruce added 18 and Curtis Jerrells 17 to lead Baylor to a 95-69 win over Grambling State on Wednesday night. En route to a 55-39 halftime lead, the Bears (5-1) shot a torrid 73 percent in the first half, hitting 19-of-26 attempts. Baylor fared even better from 3-point range with a 12-of-16 first-half performance. The Bears finished the game with 13 3-pointers in 24 attempts. The Bears put together a 20-2 run early in the contest and took a 20-5 lead with just over 13 minutes remaining in the first half. The Tigers (1-3) never recovered, and Baylor maintained a double-digit lead the rest of the way. Grambling outscored the Bears 8-5 to open the second half and cut the margin to 60-47 with 15 minutes to play. But Baylor reeled of six straight points, and the Tigers never challenged again. Andrew Prestley paced Grambling with 15 points, while Emmanuel Calloway contributed 12 and Anthony Williams and Kendric Baker had 10 each.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
